page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO FARMING
page.content: Farming in {Roughfort}is mainly pasture farming. There are generally small farms in our block. The largest being 80 acres, the smallest is 41 acres. There was some land for grazing cattle,sheep and goats. One farmer {Mr {McBride} supplied milk to {Dale Farm {Dairies}in Ballymena. This was collected twice daily,in the morning and in the evening. The grass left over was turned into hay and silage or in some cases it was sent to poorer farms. Helpers were employed at the farms from nearby on a daily basis. The helpers usually had to build up fences around the fields. In some farms, electric fences were installed. The biggest farms turned out to be the oldest because they had developed over the years.
